    #General Relativity

    (i) The metric of any two-dimensional curved space, rotationally symmetric about a point PPP, can by suitable choice of coordinates be written locally in the form

    ds2=e2ϕ(r)(dr2+r2dθ2),d s^{2}=e^{2 \phi(r)}\left(d r^{2}+r^{2} d \theta^{2}\right), ds2=e2ϕ(r)(dr2+r2dθ2),

    where r=0r=0r=0 at P,r>0P, r>0P,r>0 away from PPP, and 0⩽θ<2π0 \leqslant \theta<2 \pi0⩽θ<2π.     The Ricci tensor Rab(a,b=1,2)R_{a b}(a, b=1,2)Rab​(a,b=1,2) is defined by

    Rab=Γab,cc−Γac,bc+ΓcdcΓabd−ΓacdΓbdc,R_{a b}=\Gamma_{a b, c}^{c}-\Gamma_{a c, b}^{c}+\Gamma_{c d}^{c} \Gamma_{a b}^{d}-\Gamma_{a c}^{d} \Gamma_{b d}^{c}, Rab​=Γab,cc​−Γac,bc​+Γcdc​Γabd​−Γacd​Γbdc​,

    where a comma denotes a partial derivative. Show that R12=0R_{12}=0R12​=0 and that

    R11=−ϕ′′−r−1ϕ′,R22=r2R11R_{11}=-\phi^{\prime \prime}-r^{-1} \phi^{\prime}, \quad R_{22}=r^{2} R_{11} R11​=−ϕ′′−r−1ϕ′,R22​=r2R11​

    (ii) Suppose further that, in a neighbourhood of PPP, the Ricci scalar RRR takes the constant value −2-2−2. Find a second order differential equation, which you should denote by (∗)(*)(∗), for ϕ(r)\phi(r)ϕ(r).

    This space of constant Ricci scalar can, by a suitable coordinate transformation r→χ(r)r \rightarrow \chi(r)r→χ(r), leaving θ\thetaθ invariant, be written locally as

    ds2=dχ2+sinh⁡2χdθ2d s^{2}=d \chi^{2}+\sinh ^{2} \chi d \theta^{2} ds2=dχ2+sinh2χdθ2

    eϕ(r)=2A(1−A2r2),(0⩽Ar<1)e^{\phi(r)}=\frac{2 A}{\left(1-A^{2} r^{2}\right)} \quad, \quad(0 \leqslant A r<1) eϕ(r)=(1−A2r2)2A​,(0⩽Ar<1)

    where A\mathrm{A}A is a positive constant and verify that your equation (∗)(*)(∗) for ϕ\phiϕ holds.

    [Note that

    ∫dχsinh⁡χ= const. +12log⁡(cosh⁡χ−1)−12log⁡(cosh⁡χ+1).]\left.\int \frac{d \chi}{\sinh \chi}=\text { const. }+\frac{1}{2} \log (\cosh \chi-1)-\frac{1}{2} \log (\cosh \chi+1) .\right] ∫sinhχdχ​= const. +21​log(coshχ−1)−21​log(coshχ+1).]
